member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CulDeSacMasks
member.summary: Creates a feature class of polygon masks from a symbolized input line layer.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CulDeSacMasks.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Double,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: Input line layer from which to create masks. (In, Required)
The feature class that will contain the mask features. (Out, Required)
The reference scale used for calculating the masking geometry when masks are specified in page units. This is typically the reference scale of the map. (In, Required)

The spatial reference for which the masking polygons will be created. This is not the spatial reference that will be assigned to the output feature class. It is the spatial reference of the map in which the masking polygons will be used since the position of symbology may change when features are projected. (In, Required)

The space in page units surrounding the symbolized input features used to create the mask polygon. Typically, masking polygons are created with a small margin around the symbol to improve visual appearance. Margin values are specified in either page units or map units. Most of the time you will want to specify your margin distance value in page units. (In, Required)

member.summary: Places a representation control point at vertices along a line or polygon boundary where the inner angle is less than or equal to a specified maximum angle.

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input feature layer containing line or polygon representations. (In, Required)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateOverpass
member.summary: Allows intersecting lines to be displayed as overpassing one another by creating bridge parapets and masks to cover the underlying road segment.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateOverpass.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input line feature layer containing stroke representations that intersect—and will be symbolized as passing above—stroke representations in the Input Below Features. (In, Required)

The input line feature layer containing stroke representations that intersect—and will be symbolized as passing below—stroke representations in the Input Above Features. These features will be masked by the polygons created in the Output Overpass feature class. (In, Required)

Sets the length of the mask polygons along the Input Above Features by specifying the distance in page units that the mask should extend beyond the width of the stroke symbol of the Input Below Features. The Margin Along must be specified, and it must be greater than or equal to zero. Choose a page unit (points, millimeters, and so on) for the margin; the default is points. (In, Required)

Sets the width of the mask polygons across the Input Above Features by specifying the distance in page units that the mask should extend beyond the width of the stroke symbol of the Input Below Features. The Margin Across must be specified, and it must be greater than or equal to zero. Choose a page unit (points, millimeters, and so on) for the margin; the default is points. (In, Required)
The output feature class that will be created to store polygons to mask the Input Below features. (Out, Required)
The output relationship class that will be created to store links between Overpass mask polygons and the stroke representations of the Input Below Features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateOverpass.in_above_features
member.summary: The input line feature layer containing stroke representations that intersect—and will be symbolized as passing above—stroke representations in the Input Below Features. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateOverpass.in_below_features
member.summary: The input line feature layer containing stroke representations that intersect—and will be symbolized as passing below—stroke representations in the Input Above Features. These features will be masked by the polygons created in the Output Overpass feature class. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateOverpass.margin_along
member.summary: Sets the length of the mask polygons along the Input Above Features by specifying the distance in page units that the mask should extend beyond the width of the stroke symbol of the Input Below Features. The Margin Along must be specified, and it must be greater than or equal to zero. Choose a page unit (points, millimeters, and so on) for the margin; the default is points. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateOverpass.margin_across
member.summary: Sets the width of the mask polygons across the Input Above Features by specifying the distance in page units that the mask should extend beyond the width of the stroke symbol of the Input Below Features. The Margin Across must be specified, and it must be greater than or equal to zero. Choose a page unit (points, millimeters, and so on) for the margin; the default is points. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateOverpass.out_overpass_feature_class
member.summary: The output feature class that will be created to store polygons to mask the Input Below features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateOverpass.out_mask_relationship_class
member.summary: The output relationship class that will be created to store links between Overpass mask polygons and the stroke representations of the Input Below Features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateOverpass.where_clause
member.summary: A SQL expression used to select a subset of features in the Input Above Features with Representations parameter. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateOverpass.out_decoration_feature_class
member.summary: The output line feature class that will be created to store parapet features. (Out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateOverpass.wing_type
member.summary: Specifies the wing style of the parapet features. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateOverpass.wing_tick_length
member.summary: Sets the length of the parapet wings in page units. The length must be greater than or equal to zero; the default length is 1. Choose a page unit (Points, Millimeters, and so on) for the length; the default is Points. This parameter does not apply to the Wing Type - NONE. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DisperseMarkers
member.summary: Finds representation markers that are overlapping or too close to one another and spreads them apart based on a minimum spacing and dispersal pattern.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DisperseMarkers.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input point feature layer containing marker representations. (In, Required)

The minimum separation distance between individual markers, in page units. A distance must be specified and must be greater than or equal to zero. When a positive value is specified, markers will be separated by that value; when a value of zero is specified, markers will be touching. The default page unit is Points. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DisperseMarkers.in_point_features
member.summary: The input point feature layer containing marker representations. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DisperseMarkers.minimum_spacing
member.summary: The minimum separation distance between individual markers, in page units. A distance must be specified and must be greater than or equal to zero. When a positive value is specified, markers will be separated by that value; when a value of zero is specified, markers will be touching. The default page unit is Points. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DisperseMarkers.dispersal_pattern
member.summary: Specifies the pattern in which the dispersed representation markers are placed. A group of markers will have a center of mass derived from the locations of each marker in the group. The center of mass is then used as the anchor point around which the dispersal pattern operates. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DisperseMarkers.out_representations
member.summary: Output Representations (out, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DetectGraphicConflict
member.summary: Creates polygons where two or more symbolized features graphically conflict.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DetectGraphicConflict.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input feature layer containing symbolized features. (In, Required)
The feature layer containing symbolized features potentially in conflict with symbolized features in the input layer. (In, Required)
The output feature class to be created to store conflict polygons. It cannot be one of the feature classes associated with the input layers. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DetectGraphicConflict.in_features
member.summary: The input feature layer containing symbolized features. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DetectGraphicConflict.conflict_features
member.summary: The feature layer containing symbolized features potentially in conflict with symbolized features in the input layer. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DetectGraphicConflict.out_feature_class
member.summary: The output feature class to be created to store conflict polygons. It cannot be one of the feature classes associated with the input layers. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DetectGraphicConflict.conflict_distance
member.summary: Sets the conflict distance. Temporary buffers one-half the size of the conflict distance value are created around symbols in both the input and conflict layers. Conflict polygons will be generated where these buffers overlap. Conflict distance is measured in page units (Points, Inches, Millimeters, Centimeters). If you enter a conflict distance in map units, it will be converted to page units using the reference scale. The default conflict distance is 0, where no buffers are created and only symbols that physically overlap one another are detected as conflicts. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DetectGraphicConflict.line_connection_allowance
member.summary: The radius of a circle, centered where lines join, within which graphic overlaps won't be detected. This parameter is only considered when the input layer and the conflict layer are identical. Zero allowance will detect a conflict at each line join (if end caps are overlapping). Line connection allowance is calculated in page units (Points, Inches, Millimeters, Centimeters). If you enter a conflict distance in map units, it will be converted to page units using the reference scale. The value cannot be negative; the default value is 1 Point. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CalculateAdjacentFields
member.summary: The most common use case for using this tool is to populate fields that can be used to label the adjacent pages in a map book. This tool appends eight new fields (each field representing one of the eight points of the compass: North, Northeast, East, Southeast, South, Southwest, West and Northwest) to the input feature class and calculates values that identify the adjacent (neighboring) polygons, in each cardinal direction, for each feature in the input feature class.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CalculateGridConvergenceAngle.coordinate_sys_field
member.summary: Field containing a projection engine string for a projected coordinate system to be used for angle calculation. The angle calculation for each feature will be based on the projected coordinate system projection engine string for the specific feature. In cases where there is an invalid value the tool will use the Cartographic Coordinate System specified in the Cartography environment settings. The default is none, or no field specified. When no field is specified the projected coordinate system used for calculation will be taken from the Cartography environment settings. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ThinRoadNetwork
member.summary: Generates a simplified road network that retains connectivity and general character to display at a smaller scale.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ThinRoadNetwork.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input linear roads that should be thinned to create a simplified collection for display at smaller scales. (In, Required)

An indication of the shortest road segment that is sensible to display at the output scale. This controls the resolution, or density, of the resulting road collection. If the units are in point, mm, cm, or inches the value is considered in page units and the reference scale is taken into account. (In, Required)

The field that stores the results of the tool. Features that participate in the resulting simplified road collection have a value of 0 (zero). Those that are extraneous have a value of 1. A layer definition query can be used to display the resulting road collection. This field must be present and named the same for each input feature class. (In, Required)

The field that contains hierarchical ranking of feature importance, where 1 is very important and larger integers reflect decreasing importance. A value of 0 forces the feature to remain visible in the output collection. This field must be present and named the same for each input feature class. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ThinRoadNetwork.in_features
member.summary: The input linear roads that should be thinned to create a simplified collection for display at smaller scales. (In, Required)

member.summary: An indication of the shortest road segment that is sensible to display at the output scale. This controls the resolution, or density, of the resulting road collection. If the units are in point, mm, cm, or inches the value is considered in page units and the reference scale is taken into account. (In, Required)

member.summary: The field that stores the results of the tool. Features that participate in the resulting simplified road collection have a value of 0 (zero). (In, Required)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ResolveBuildingConflicts
member.summary: Resolves symbol conflicts among buildings and with respect to linear barrier features by moving or hiding buildings.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ResolveBuildingConflicts.#ctor(System.Object,System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input layers containing building features that may be in conflict, or smaller than allowable size. Buildings can be either points or polygons. Buildings will be modified to resolve conflicts with other buildings and with barrier features. (In, Required)

The field that stores the invisibility values that can be used to remove some buildings from display in order to resolve symbol conflicts. Buildings with a value of 1 should be removed from display; those with a value of zero should remain. Use a definition query on the layer to display visible buildings only. No features are deleted. (In, Required)

The layers containing the linear or polygon features that are conflict barriers for input building features. Buildings will be modified to resolve conflicts between buildings and barriers. Orient value is Boolean, specifying whether buildings should be oriented to the barrier layer. (In, Required)

The minimum allowable distance between symbolized buildings at scale. Buildings that are closer together will be displaced or hidden to enforce this distance. The minimum allowable distance is set relative to the reference scale (i.e. 15 meters at 1:50,000 scale). The value is 0 if reference scale is not set. (In, Required)

The minimum allowable size of the shortest side of a rotated best-fit bounding box around the symbolized building feature drawn at the reference scale. Buildings with a bounding box side smaller than this value will be enlarged to meet it. Resizing may happen nonproportionally resulting in a change to building morphology. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ResolveBuildingConflicts.in_buildings
member.summary: The input layers containing building features that may be in conflict, or smaller than allowable size. Buildings can be either points or polygons. Buildings will be modified to resolve conflicts with other buildings and with barrier features. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ResolveBuildingConflicts.invisibility_field
member.summary: The field that stores the invisibility values that can be used to remove some buildings from display in order to resolve symbol conflicts. Buildings with a value of 1 should be removed from display; those with a value of zero should remain. Use a definition query on the layer to display visible buildings only. No features are deleted. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ResolveBuildingConflicts.in_barriers
member.summary: The layers containing the linear or polygon features that are conflict barriers for input building features. Buildings will be modified to resolve conflicts between buildings and barriers. Orient value is Boolean, specifying whether buildings should be oriented to the barrier layer. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ResolveBuildingConflicts.building_gap
member.summary: The minimum allowable distance between symbolized buildings at scale. Buildings that are closer together will be displaced or hidden to enforce this distance. The minimum allowable distance is set relative to the reference scale (i.e. 15 meters at 1:50,000 scale). The value is 0 if reference scale is not set. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ResolveBuildingConflicts.minimum_size
member.summary: The minimum allowable size of the shortest side of a rotated best-fit bounding box around the symbolized building feature drawn at the reference scale. Buildings with a bounding box side smaller than this value will be enlarged to meet it. Resizing may happen nonproportionally resulting in a change to building morphology. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ResolveBuildingConflicts.hierarchy_field
member.summary: The field that contains hierarchical ranking of feature importance, where 1 is very important and larger integers reflect decreasing importance. A value of 0 (zero) forced the building to retain visibility, although it may be moved somewhat to resolve conflicts. If this parameter is not used, feature importance will be assessed by the tool based on perimeter length and proximity to barrier features. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Output Layers (out, Optional)

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input linear road features that contain matched pairs of divided road lanes which should be merged together to a single output line feature. (In, Required)

The field that contains road classification information. Only parallel, proximate roads of equal classification will be merged. A value of 0 (zero) locks a feature to prevent it from participating in merging. (In, Required)

The minimum distance apart, in the specified units, for equal-class, relatively parallel road features to be merged. This distance must be greater than zero. If the units are in pt, mm, cm, or in, the value is considered as page units and takes into account the reference scale. (In, Required)
The output feature class containing single line merged road features and all unmerged road features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MergeDividedRoads.merge_distance

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures
member.summary: Creates a grid of rectangular of polygon features that can be used as an index to specify pages for a map book using Data Driven Pages. A grid can be created that only includes polygon features that intersect another feature layer.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: Resulting feature class of polygon index features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.out_feature_class
member.summary: Resulting feature class of polygon index features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.in_features
member.summary: Input features can be used to define the extent of the polygon grid that is created. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.intersect_feature
member.summary: Limits the output grid feature class to only areas that intersect input feature layers or datasets. When input features are specified, the default value is INTERSECTFEATURE. The intersection of input features will be used to create index features. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.use_page_unit
member.summary: Indicates whether index polygon size input is in page units. The default is NO_USEPAGEUNIT. The tool uses map units by default. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.scale
member.summary: Scale must be specified if the index polygon height and width are to be calculated in page units.. If the tool is being used outside of an active ArcMap session the default scale value is 1. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.polygon_width
member.summary: Width of the index polygon specifed in either map or page units. If page units are being used the default value is 1 inch. If map units are being used the default is 1 degree. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.polygon_height
member.summary: Height of the index polygon specifed in either map or page units. If page units are being used the default value is 1 inch. If map units are being used the default is 1 degree. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.origin_coord
member.summary: Coordinate for the lower left origin of the output grid feature class. If input features are specified the default value is determined by the extent of the union of extents for these features. If there are no input features specified, the default coordinates are 0 and 0. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.number_rows
member.summary: Number of rows to create in the y direction from the point of origin. The default is 10. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.number_columns
member.summary: Number of columns to create in the x direction from the point of origin. The default is 10. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.starting_page_number
member.summary: Each grid index feature is assigned a sequential page number starting with a specified starting page number. The default is 1. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.label_from_origin
member.summary: Page numbers (labels) starting with the specified starting page number (default is 1) begins with the cell in the lower left corner of the output grid. The default is NO_LABELFROMORIGIN. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures
member.summary: Creates a series of rectangular polygons, or index features, that follow a single linear feature or a group of linear features. These index features can be used with Data Driven Pages to define pages within a strip map, or set of maps that follow a linear feature. The resulting index features contain attributes that can be used to rotate and orient the map on the page and determine which index features, or pages, are next to the current page (to the left and right or to the top and bottom).

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: Input polyline or polylines defining the path of the strip map index features. (In, Required)
Resulting feature class of polygon index features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures.in_features
member.summary: Input polyline or polylines defining the path of the strip map index features. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures.out_feature_class
member.summary: Resulting feature class of polygon index features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures.use_page_unit
member.summary: Indicates whether index feature size input is in page space. The default value is NO_USEPAGEUNIT. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures.scale
member.summary: Map scale must be specified if index feature lengths (along the line and perpendicular to the line) are to be calculated in page space. If ArcMap is open the default value will be the scale of the active data frame. If ArcMap is not open the default will be 1. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures.length_along_line
member.summary: Length of the polygon index feature along the input line feature specifed in either map or page units. The default value is determined by the spatial reference of the input line feature or features. This value will be 1/100 of the input feature class extent along the X axis. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures.length_perpendicular_to_line
member.summary: Length of the polygon index feature perpendicular to the input line feature specifed in either map or page units. The default value is determined by the spatial reference of the input line feature or features. This value will be 1/2 the number used for the length along the line. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures.page_orientation
member.summary: Used to determine the orientation of the input line features on the layout page. The default is HORIZONTAL. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures.overlap_percentage
member.summary: The approximate percentage of geographic overlap between an individual map page and its adjoining pages in the series. The default is 10. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures.starting_page_number
member.summary: Each grid index feature is assigned a sequential page number starting with a specified starting page number. The default value is 1. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures.direction_type
member.summary: Index features are created in a sequential order and require a starting point. Setting the direction type for the strip map provides a starting point. The default is WE_NS. This means that the starting point for the strip map is either at the western end of the line feature if the line feature's directional trend is West to East/East to West or, if the directional trend is North to South/South to North, the starting point would be the northern most point of the line feature. The direction type is also applied to secondary line features. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MakeGridsAndGraticulesLayer
member.summary: Creates a grouped layer of feature classes depicting grid, graticule, and border features using predefined cartographic specifications. Grid layers are ideal for advanced grid definitions which are scale and extent specific.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MakeGridsAndGraticulesLayer.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The XML grid definition template stores the specification's graphic properties for each grid layer. In addition to the graphic properties, which cannot be altered before execution, the definition has specific default values, exposed as parameters, that can be modified before execution. (In, Required)
The feature layer or x,y extent used to determine the extent of the grid layer created. (In, Required)

The feature dataset that will store the features. Grid-specific feature classes will be created if they do not already exist. If they already exist, and a grid with the same name and type as the one being created also exists, it will be overwritten. (In, Required)

The grouped layer of feature classes depicting grid, graticule, and border features. Each grid layer can be composed of a mask polygon, a clip polygon, segments(line), gridlines(line), ticks(line), endpoints(point), points(point), and annotation feature classes. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MakeGridsAndGraticulesLayer.in_template
member.summary: The XML grid definition template stores the specification's graphic properties for each grid layer. In addition to the graphic properties, which cannot be altered before execution, the definition has specific default values, exposed as parameters, that can be modified before execution. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MakeGridsAndGraticulesLayer.in_aoi
member.summary: The feature layer or x,y extent used to determine the extent of the grid layer created. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MakeGridsAndGraticulesLayer.input_feature_dataset
member.summary: The feature dataset that will store the features. Grid-specific feature classes will be created if they do not already exist. If they already exist, and a grid with the same name and type as the one being created also exists, it will be overwritten. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MakeGridsAndGraticulesLayer.output_layer
member.summary: The grouped layer of feature classes depicting grid, graticule, and border features. Each grid layer can be composed of a mask polygon, a clip polygon, segments(line), gridlines(line), ticks(line), endpoints(point), points(point), and annotation feature classes. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MakeGridsAndGraticulesLayer.name
member.summary: The name for the cartographic grid created that allows for distinction between grids that are stored in the same feature dataset and set of feature classes, expressed in one of the following formats: (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MakeGridsAndGraticulesLayer.refscale
member.summary: The scale at which the grid is created and should be viewed. When the reference scale from the XML grid definition file is defined as "Use Environment", the reference scale is derived in the following order: (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MakeGridsAndGraticulesLayer.rotation
member.summary: The rotation angle for the grid components. Rotation is used to provide annotation that is level with the page. Unless otherwise specified, rotation is calculated using the area of interest feature. When the rotation type from the XML grid definition file is defined as "Use Environment", the rotation is derived in the following order: (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MakeGridsAndGraticulesLayer.mask_size
member.summary: The mask is a polygon feature that forms an outer ring around the extent of the neatline and is used to mask data that falls in the area reserved for coordinate labels. Mask size defines the width of the polygon mask feature in map or page units. The data frame may have to be resized to fit around the edge of the mask while including the coordinate labels. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MakeGridsAndGraticulesLayer.xy_tolerance
member.summary: The minimum tolerated distance between geodatabase features, expressed in linear units. This value is defaulted from the value set in the XML. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MakeGridsAndGraticulesLayer.primary_coordinate_system
member.summary: The grid template XML file creates grid components depicting coordinates or locations for a primary coordinates system and up to four ancillary coordinate systems. The number of ancillary grids is specified by the file. You cannot add or delete ancillary coordinate systems. All coordinate systems specified must share a common geographic coordinate system. If you want to change the primary coordinate system to one that uses a different datum than the default, say for example you change the coordinate system from one that uses WGS 1984 to one that uses NAD 1983, you must change each default ancillary coordinate systems to NAD 1983 as well. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MakeGridsAndGraticulesLayer.configure_layout
member.summary: Adjusts the data frame settings to ensure they match the grid layer. The data frame's coordinate system, scale, rotation, size, extent, and clipping may be altered to enforce consistency. This setting is only available when the tool is executed from ArcMap's layout view and is not being run in the background. The default is to have this check box unchecked. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ContourAnnotation
member.summary: Creates annotation for contour features.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ContourAnnotation.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Double,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.name: in_features
param.summary: The contour line feature class for which the annotation will be created. (In, Required)

param.name: out_geodatabase
param.summary: The workspace where the output feature classes will be saved. The workspace can be an existing geodatabase or an existing feature dataset. (In, Required)

param.name: contour_label_field
param.summary: The field in the input layer attribute table upon which the annotation text will be based. (In, Required)

param.name: reference_scale_value
param.summary: Enter the scale to use as a reference for the annotation. This sets the scale to which all symbol and text sizes in the annotation will be based. (In, Required)

param.name: out_layer
param.summary: The group layer that will contain the contour layer, the annotation, and the mask layer. When working in ArcCatalog, you can use the Save To Layer File tool to write the output group layer to a layer file. When using ArcMap, the tool adds the group layer to the display if this option is checked in the geoprocessing options. The group layer that is created is temporary and will not persist after the session ends unless the document is saved. (Out, Required)

param.name: contour_color
param.summary: The color of the output contour layer and annotation features. (In, Required)

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The source map document. (In, Required)

The output polygon feature class. (Out, Required)

param.summary: Choose whether to produce tiles for the entire extent of the tiling scheme or only tiles that intersect the full extent of the data frame. (In, Required)

member.summary: Choose whether to constrain the polygons to the valid area of use for the geographic or projected coordinate system of the data frame. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MapServerCacheTilingSchemeToPolygons.antialiasing
member.summary: Choose whether to generate polygons that match map service caches with anti-aliasing enabled. A map service cache supertile is 2048 x 2048 pixels with antialiasing or 4096 x 4096 pixels without. To see if antialiasing was used in an existing cache, open the tiling scheme file, conf.xml, and check to see if the <Antialiasing> tag is set to true. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MapServerCacheTilingSchemeToPolygons.levels
member.summary: The scale levels at which you will create polygons. To create polygons for all scale levels included in a tiling scheme, leave this parameter blank. You may choose to create polygons for all or only some of the scale levels that are included in your tiling scheme. To add additional scale levels, however, you will need to modify your tiling scheme file or create a new one. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.TiledLabelsToAnnotation
member.summary: Converts labels to annotation for layers in a map document based on a polygon index layer.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.TiledLabelsToAnnotation.#ctor(System.Object,System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The source map document that contains the labels to convert to annotation. (In, Required)
The data frame from the map document that contains the labels to convert to annotation. (In, Required)
The polygon layer that contains tile features. (In, Required)
The workspace where the output feature classes will be saved. The workspace can be an existing geodatabase or an existing feature dataset. (In, Required)

The group layer that will contain the generated annotation. When working in ArcCatalog, you can use the Save To Layer File tool to write the output group layer to a layer file. When using ArcMap, the tool adds the group layer to the display if this option is checked in the geoprocessing options. The group layer that is created is temporary and will not persist after the session ends unless the document is saved. (Out, Required)

The suffix that will be added to each new annotation feature class. This suffix will be appended to the name of the source feature class for each new annotation feature class. The reference scale for the annotation will follow this suffix. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.TiledLabelsToAnnotation.map_document
member.summary: The source map document that contains the labels to convert to annotation. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.TiledLabelsToAnnotation.data_frame
member.summary: The data frame from the map document that contains the labels to convert to annotation. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.TiledLabelsToAnnotation.polygon_index_layer
member.summary: The polygon layer that contains tile features. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.TiledLabelsToAnnotation.out_geodatabase
member.summary: The workspace where the output feature classes will be saved. The workspace can be an existing geodatabase or an existing feature dataset. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.TiledLabelsToAnnotation.out_layer
member.summary: The group layer that will contain the generated annotation. When working in ArcCatalog, you can use the Save To Layer File tool to write the output group layer to a layer file. When using ArcMap, the tool adds the group layer to the display if this option is checked in the geoprocessing options. The group layer that is created is temporary and will not persist after the session ends unless the document is saved. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.TiledLabelsToAnnotation.anno_suffix
member.summary: The suffix that will be added to each new annotation feature class. This suffix will be appended to the name of the source feature class for each new annotation feature class. The reference scale for the annotation will follow this suffix. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.TiledLabelsToAnnotation.reference_scale_value
member.summary: Enter the scale to use as a reference for the annotation. This sets the scale to which all symbol and text sizes in the annotation will be based. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.TiledLabelsToAnnotation.reference_scale_field
member.summary: The field in the polygon index layer that will determine the reference scale of the annotation. This sets the scale to which all symbol and text sizes in the annotation will be based. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.TiledLabelsToAnnotation.tile_id_field
member.summary: A field in the polygon index layer that uniquely identifies the tiled area. These values will populate the TileID field in the annotation feature class attribute table. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.TiledLabelsToAnnotation.coordinate_sys_field
member.summary: A field in the polygon index layer that contains the coordinate system information for each tile. Due to the length required for a field to store coordinate system information, a polygon index layer that contains a coordinate system field must be a geodatabase feature class. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.TiledLabelsToAnnotation.map_rotation_field
member.summary: A field in the polygon index layer that contains an angle by which the data frame is to be rotated. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Choose whether to create unplaced annotation from unplaced labels. (In, Optional)
